title: Mint Explainer | Will 2026 be a turning point for AI in India?
snippet: A dozen government-backed startups began building foundational AI models. Data centres saw a massive boom as Big Tech doubled down on India. What happens next in 2026?

title: Coforge and CEO Sudhir Singh take a big leap in a strained year for IT sector
snippet: Coforge Ltd has emerged an unlikely star in India's IT services sector: notching a $1.56 billion win with Sabre and buying Encora for $2.35 billion, the industry's biggest M&amp;A ever. Mint interviewed CEO Sudhir Singh to understand the company's journey so far and where it is headed next.

title: How to build AI systems in 2026? Google Brain co-founder shares three crucial tips
snippet: AI pioneer Andrew Ng shares three essential tips for people entering the field of artificial intelligence. He urges them to take structured AI courses, practice building systems, and read research papers. Ng also emphasizes understanding foundations to avoid reinventing the wheel.

title: Centre issues warning to social media platforms over obscene and vulgar content
snippet: The Ministry of Electronics and IT has issued a warning to social media platforms to remove illegal content or face prosecution under the IT Act. Companies must review compliance frameworks and act swiftly against obscene material

title: Realme 16 Pro+ 5G set to launch in India on 6 January: top 5 things we already know
snippet: Realme 16 Pro+ will launch in India on 6 January. The 16 Pro+ features a Snapdragon 7 Gen 4 processor, 7,000mAh battery with 80W charging, and a 200MP camera. It supports Realme UI 7.0 and offers 4 years of software updates.

title: Satya Nadella warns of ‘model overhang’ in 2026, says AI capabilities outpacing real-world impact
snippet: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella predicts 2026 will be crucial for AI. He emphasizes the need for AI to support human thinking, focusing on real-world impact and collaboration among models to overcome limitations.

snippet: ByteDance is planning a sharp rise in spending on Nvidia AI chips in 2026, according to a report by the South China Morning ‍Post. The increase depends on whether the US firm is allowed to sell its advanced H200 processors in China.

title: TSMC says started mass production of 'most advanced' 2nm chips
snippet: Taiwan’s TSMC has begun mass production of its new 2-nanometre chips, the most advanced it has ever made. title: Banks are pushing video KYC adoption as financial frauds tick up
snippet: The central bank allows lenders to open digital savings accounts with just a basic Aadhaar and PAN card check. However, rules mandate a deposit limit of Rs 1 lakh in such accounts, and their conversion into full-KYC accounts within one year.
